cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northeast across the southeastern United States Saturday, turning east-northeast, moving off the North Carolina coast Sunday night and then away into the western Atlantic Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near or just east of Apalachicola

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch/warning confined to Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL; Storm-surge warning Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, inland Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts, and eventually the mid-Atlantic offshore waters
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds Sunday afternoon into early Monday, occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible, sustained tropical-storm force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the upper Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Sunday–Sunday night with locally higher amounts in bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibility in heavy rain bands; elevated seas and short-period swell on approaches to Chesapeake Bay may affect pilot boarding operations
